verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, Hew thee two tables of stone like unto the first: and I will write upon these tables the words that were in the first tables, which thou brakest.
verses.web: LORD said to Moses, “Chisel two stone tablets like the first. I will write on the tablets the words that were on the first tablets, which you broke.
verses.ct: The LORD told Moses, "Chisel out 2 stone tablets just like the first ones. I will write on them the same words that were on the tablets you broke."

verses.kjv: And be ready in the morning, and come up in the morning unto mount Sinai, and present thyself there to me in the top of the mount.
verses.web: Be ready by the morning, and come up in the morning to Mount Sinai, and present yourself there to me on the top of the mountain.
verses.ct: "Be ready by morning. Come up Mount Sinai and stand before me at the top of the mountain."

verses.kjv: And no man shall come up with thee, neither let any man be seen throughout all the mount; neither let the flocks nor herds feed before that mount.
verses.web: No one shall come up with you or be seen anywhere on the mountain. Do not let the flocks or herds graze in front of that mountain.”
verses.ct: "No one is allowed to come with you. No one should even be seen anywhere on the mountain. Don't let any flocks or herds graze near it."

verses.kjv: And he hewed two tables of stone like unto the first; and Moses rose up early in the morning, and went up unto mount Sinai, as the LORD had commanded him, and took in his hand the two tables of stone.
verses.web: He chiseled two tablets of stone like the first; then Moses rose up early in the morning, and went up to Mount Sinai, as LORD had commanded him, and took in his hand two stone tablets.
verses.ct: So Moses chiseled out 2 stone tablets just like the originals. He got up early the next morning and climbed Mount Sinai, just as the LORD had commanded, carrying the 2 stone tablets in his hands.

verses.kjv: And the LORD descended in the cloud, and stood with him there, and proclaimed the name of the LORD.
verses.web: LORD descended in the cloud, and stood with him there, and proclaimed LORD’s name.
verses.ct: The LORD came down in a cloud and stood there with him, and he proclaimed his own name — the LORD.

verses.kjv: And the LORD passed by before him, and proclaimed, The LORD, The LORD God, merciful and gracious, longsuffering, and abundant in goodness and truth,
verses.web: LORD passed by before him, and proclaimed, “LORD! LORD, a merciful and gracious God, slow to anger, and abundant in loving kindness and truth,
verses.ct: The LORD passed in front of Moses and declared: "The LORD! The LORD God — merciful and gracious, slow to anger, overflowing with goodness and truth,

verses.kjv: Keeping mercy for thousands, forgiving iniquity and transgression and sin, and that will by no means clear the guilty; visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the children, and upon the children’s children, unto the third and to the fourth generation.
verses.web: keeping loving kindness for thousands, forgiving iniquity and disobedience and sin; and who will by no means clear the guilty, visiting the iniquity of the fathers on the children, and on the children’s children, on the third and on the fourth generation.”
verses.ct: showing mercy to thousands of generations, forgiving wickedness, rebellion, and sin. Yet he does not leave the guilty unpunished. He holds children and grandchildren accountable for their parents' sins, down to the 3rd and 4th generation."

verses.kjv: And Moses made haste, and bowed his head toward the earth, and worshipped.
verses.web: Moses hurried and bowed his head toward the earth, and worshiped.
verses.ct: Moses immediately bowed low to the ground and worshiped.

verses.kjv: And he said, If now I have found grace in thy sight, O LORD, let my LORD, I pray thee, go among us; for it is a stiffnecked people; and pardon our iniquity and our sin, and take us for thine inheritance.
verses.web: He said, “If now I have found favor in your sight, Lord, please let the Lord go among us, even though this is a stiff-necked people; pardon our iniquity and our sin, and take us for your inheritance.”
verses.ct: He said, "LORD, if I have found favor with you, please travel among us. Yes, these people are stubborn, but forgive our wickedness and our sin, and claim us as your own."

verses.kjv: And he said, Behold, I make a covenant: before all thy people I will do marvels, such as have not been done in all the earth, nor in any nation: and all the people among which thou art shall see the work of the LORD: for it is a terrible thing that I will do with thee.
verses.web: He said, “Behold, I make a covenant: before all your people I will do marvels, such as have not been worked in all the earth, nor in any nation; and all the people among whom you are shall see the work of LORD; for it is an awesome thing that I do with you.
verses.ct: The LORD replied, "I am making a covenant with you right now. In front of all your people, I will do wonders that have never been performed anywhere on earth or among any nation. Everyone around you will witness the work of the LORD, because what I am about to do through you will be awe-inspiring.

verses.kjv: Observe thou that which I command thee this day: behold, I drive out before thee the Amorite, and the Canaanite, and the Hittite, and the Perizzite, and the Hivite, and the Jebusite.
verses.web: Observe that which I command you today. Behold, I will drive out before you the Amorite, the Canaanite, the Hittite, the Perizzite, the Hivite, and the Jebusite.
verses.ct: Obey everything I command you today. I am going to drive out the Amorites, Canaanites, Hittites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites ahead of you.

verses.kjv: Take heed to thyself, lest thou make a covenant with the inhabitants of the land whither thou goest, lest it be for a snare in the midst of thee:
verses.web: Be careful, lest you make a covenant with the inhabitants of the land where you are going, lest it be for a snare among you;
verses.ct: Be very careful not to make any treaty with the people living in the land you're entering, or they will become a trap for you.

verses.kjv: But ye shall destroy their altars, break their images, and cut down their groves:
verses.web: but you shall break down their altars, and dash in pieces their pillars, and you shall cut down their Asherah poles;
verses.ct: Instead, tear down their altars, smash their sacred pillars, and chop down their Asherah poles.

verses.kjv: For thou shalt worship no other god: for the LORD, whose name is Jealous, is a jealous God:
verses.web: for you shall worship no other god; for LORD, whose name is Jealous, is a jealous God.
verses.ct: You must never worship any other god, because the LORD — whose very name is Jealous — is a jealous God.

verses.kjv: Lest thou make a covenant with the inhabitants of the land, and they go a whoring after their gods, and do sacrifice unto their gods, and one call thee, and thou eat of his sacrifice;
verses.web: “Don’t make a covenant with the inhabitants of the land, lest they play the prostitute after their gods, and sacrifice to their gods, and one call you and you eat of his sacrifice;
verses.ct: Never make a treaty with the people of that land. When they chase after their gods and offer sacrifices to them, they'll invite you to join in and eat their sacrifices.

verses.kjv: And thou take of their daughters unto thy sons, and their daughters go a whoring after their gods, and make thy sons go a whoring after their gods.
verses.web: and you take of their daughters to your sons, and their daughters play the prostitute after their gods, and make your sons play the prostitute after their gods.
verses.ct: Then you'll start taking their daughters as wives for your sons, and those women will lead your sons to chase after their gods too.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt make thee no molten gods.
verses.web: “You shall make no cast idols for yourselves.
verses.ct: You must never make cast metal idols for yourselves.

verses.kjv: The feast of unleavened bread shalt thou keep. Seven days thou shalt eat unleavened bread, as I commanded thee, in the time of the month Abib: for in the month Abib thou camest out from Egypt.
verses.web: “You shall keep the feast of unleavened bread. Seven days you shall eat unleavened bread, as I commanded you, at the time appointed in the month Abib; for in the month Abib you came out of Egypt.
verses.ct: Celebrate the Feast of Unleavened Bread. For 7 days eat bread made without yeast, as I commanded you, at the appointed time in the month of Abib — because that's the month you came out of Egypt.

verses.kjv: All that openeth the matrix is mine; and every firstling among thy cattle, whether ox or sheep, that is male.
verses.web: “All that opens the womb is mine; and all your livestock that is male, the firstborn of cow and sheep.
verses.ct: Every firstborn belongs to me — including every firstborn male from your livestock, whether cattle or sheep.

verses.kjv: But the firstling of an ass thou shalt redeem with a lamb: and if thou redeem him not, then shalt thou break his neck. All the firstborn of thy sons thou shalt redeem. And none shall appear before me empty.
verses.web: You shall redeem the firstborn of a donkey with a lamb. If you will not redeem it, then you shall break its neck. You shall redeem all the firstborn of your sons. No one shall appear before me empty.
verses.ct: You may buy back a firstborn donkey by offering a lamb in its place. If you don't buy it back, you must break its neck. You must also buy back every firstborn son. No one is to come before me empty-handed.

verses.kjv: Six days thou shalt work, but on the seventh day thou shalt rest: in earing time and in harvest thou shalt rest.
verses.web: “Six days you shall work, but on the seventh day you shall rest: in plowing time and in harvest you shall rest.
verses.ct: Work for 6 days, but on the 7th day you must rest — even during plowing season and harvest.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt observe the feast of weeks, of the firstfruits of wheat harvest, and the feast of ingathering at the year’s end.
verses.web: “You shall observe the feast of weeks with the first fruits of wheat harvest, and the feast of harvest at the year’s end.
verses.ct: Celebrate the Feast of Weeks with the first fruits of your wheat harvest, and the Feast of Ingathering at the end of the year.

verses.kjv: Thrice in the year shall all your menchildren appear before the LORD God, the God of Israel.
verses.web: Three times in the year all your males shall appear before the Lord LORD, the God of Israel.
verses.ct: 3 times a year, every male among you must appear before the Lord GOD, the God of Israel.

verses.kjv: For I will cast out the nations before thee, and enlarge thy borders: neither shall any man desire thy land, when thou shalt go up to appear before the LORD thy God thrice in the year.
verses.web: For I will drive out nations before you and enlarge your borders; neither shall any man desire your land when you go up to appear before LORD, your God, three times in the year.
verses.ct: I will drive out nations ahead of you and expand your territory. No one will even try to take your land during those times when you go to appear before the LORD your God 3 times a year.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt not offer the blood of my sacrifice with leaven; neither shall the sacrifice of the feast of the passover be left unto the morning.
verses.web: “You shall not offer the blood of my sacrifice with leavened bread. The sacrifice of the feast of the Passover shall not be left to the morning.
verses.ct: Don't offer the blood of my sacrifice alongside anything made with yeast. Nothing from the Passover sacrifice should be left over until morning.

verses.kjv: The first of the firstfruits of thy land thou shalt bring unto the house of the LORD thy God. Thou shalt not seethe a kid in his mother’s milk.
verses.web: “You shall bring the first of the first fruits of your ground to the house of LORD your God. “You shall not boil a young goat in its mother’s milk.”
verses.ct: Bring the very best of the first fruits from your land to the house of the LORD your God. Never boil a young goat in its mother's milk."

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, Write thou these words: for after the tenor of these words I have made a covenant with thee and with Israel.
verses.web: LORD said to Moses, “Write these words; for in accordance with these words I have made a covenant with you and with Israel.”
verses.ct: Then the LORD told Moses, "Write down these words, because this covenant I've made with you and with Israel is based on exactly these terms."

verses.kjv: And he was there with the LORD forty days and forty nights; he did neither eat bread, nor drink water. And he wrote upon the tables the words of the covenant, the ten commandments.
verses.web: He was there with LORD forty days and forty nights; he neither ate bread, nor drank water. He wrote on the tablets the words of the covenant, the ten commandments.
verses.ct: Moses stayed there with the LORD for 40 days and 40 nights without eating any food or drinking any water. And the LORD wrote on the tablets the words of the covenant — the 10 commandments.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Moses came down from mount Sinai with the two tables of testimony in Moses’ hand, when he came down from the mount, that Moses wist not that the skin of his face shone while he talked with him.
verses.web: When Moses came down from Mount Sinai with the two tablets of the covenant in Moses’ hand, when he came down from the mountain, Moses didn’t know that the skin of his face shone by reason of his speaking with him.
verses.ct: When Moses came down from Mount Sinai carrying the 2 tablets of the covenant, he didn't realize that his face was glowing because he had been speaking with God.

verses.kjv: And when Aaron and all the children of Israel saw Moses, behold, the skin of his face shone; and they were afraid to come nigh him.
verses.web: When Aaron and all the children of Israel saw Moses, behold, the skin of his face shone; and they were afraid to come near him.
verses.ct: When Aaron and all the Israelites saw Moses, his face was radiating light, and they were afraid to go near him.

verses.kjv: And Moses called unto them; and Aaron and all the rulers of the congregation returned unto him: and Moses talked with them.
verses.web: Moses called to them, and Aaron and all the rulers of the congregation returned to him; and Moses spoke to them.
verses.ct: But Moses called out to them. Aaron and all the leaders of the community came back to him, and Moses spoke with them.

verses.kjv: And afterward all the children of Israel came nigh: and he gave them in commandment all that the LORD had spoken with him in mount Sinai.
verses.web: Afterward all the children of Israel came near, and he gave them all the commandments that LORD had spoken with him on Mount Sinai.
verses.ct: After that, all the Israelites came closer, and Moses gave them every command the LORD had spoken to him on Mount Sinai.

verses.kjv: And till Moses had done speaking with them, he put a vail on his face.
verses.web: When Moses was done speaking with them, he put a veil on his face.
verses.ct: When Moses finished speaking to them, he covered his face with a veil.

verses.kjv: But when Moses went in before the LORD to speak with him, he took the vail off, until he came out. And he came out, and spake unto the children of Israel that which he was commanded.
verses.web: But when Moses went in before LORD to speak with him, he took the veil off, until he came out; and he came out, and spoke to the children of Israel that which he was commanded.
verses.ct: Whenever Moses went into the LORD's presence to speak with him, he would remove the veil until he came back out. Then he would tell the Israelites everything he had been commanded.

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel saw the face of Moses, that the skin of Moses’ face shone: and Moses put the vail upon his face again, until he went in to speak with him.
verses.web: The children of Israel saw Moses’ face, that the skin of Moses’ face shone; so Moses put the veil on his face again, until he went in to speak with him.
verses.ct: The Israelites could see that Moses' face was glowing. So Moses would put the veil back over his face until the next time he went in to speak with the LORD.
